intro: Zigadenus texensis, commonly known as the Texas death cup, is a toxic flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is part of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves. It contains various toxic alkaloids, making it dangerous to both animals and humans. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided in gardens and natural areas.
